content.description:
There are 2 option for climbing "Through the Roof":

Start outside the the large, detached boulder clipping 2 bolts same as "

In the Groove

", step over the gap clipping the next bolt on "

In the Groove

", veer right clipping 4 bolts for "Through the Roof", and finish on 2 Mussy hooks hanging in the roof.

Start behind the the large, detached boulder clipping 2 bolts same as "

'round the Corner

". At this point, go straight up clipping 4 bolts for "Through the Roof", finishing on 2 Mussy hooks hanging in the roof.
content.protection: 6 or 7 bolts (depending on how its climbed) with 2 Mussy hooks.
content.location:
This route is right of "

In the Groove

" or left of "

'round the Corner

".

content.description: Split Personality is worth the bolts. It is short and steep.
content.location: This is left of the boulder.

content.description: It goes up the low angle slab to the notch.
content.location: This is the leftmost route on this wall.

content.description: This is a great crack on the far right side of the crag.
content.protection: A standard rack to bolted anchors.
content.location: It is the crack to the right of the first bolted line you encounter.

content.description: Stay on the line for the most fun.
content.location:
It is around the corner from the obvious large block/start of

'round the Corner

.

content.description:
Start on the outside of the large bolder following

'round the Corner

. Once you cross the gap, head left into the shallow dihedral, but stay right of the bolts of the

12 next door

.

On the left side of the gully in the middle of the crag is the start. The bolt line follows the right side of the left corner. The boulder start makes this a 5.11; however, stemming the chimney the opposing wall variation is 5.9.
content.location: It is in the large gully in the middle of the crag behind the large, detached boulder.

content.description:
Brussel Sprouts is darn hard and starts with

'round the Corner

then cuts off left to the highest visible anchors on the point.

Becky is the first bolted line you encounter at the crag. It is just to the left of the obvious crack/trad line. This route shares anchors with

Allison's Issue

.

Climb past four bolts up the rock to the right of the gully. This shares anchors with "

Becky

," which is the first bolted route you encounter on the cliff.

This route goes up the detached boulder, crosses the gap, then heads right around the corner. After crossing the gap, the bolting is in an awkward spot on easy terrain before you get around the corner, which could result in a decent fall into the gap.
content.location: Find the large, detached boulder climb over the face. The route heads up the right side to an airy section before making it to the anchors.
